title.narrative: Humanitarian Assistance for Returnees and Affected people by Rehabilitate their privet apartments

description.narrative: The project main goal is to contribute towards the resilience and cohesion of communities and households by improving housing in the targeted communities. The project aims to support to sustainably rehabilitate housing to affected and returned families in the most vulnerable areas. The response modalities used will include in-kind and direct assistance to implement small-scale rehabilitation works for private apartments of returnees and affected people in the targeted areas . Since the conflict in Syria before ten years all of the population has been forced to the flee their homes often multiple times which affected the quality of life and exposed them to multiple risks and violations of their rights, there have been countless deaths, devastating injuries, illness and no humanitarian dignity. The results of the crisis variables and the secure stutes of many areas and cities in Syria have led to various needs. These results are obvious particularly in areas that are receiving newly returnee families. Despite the large destruction and damage to facilities and buildings, an active returning movement of IDPs has been noticed to rural Areas. According to HNO 2020, an estimated of 5.65 million people, including IDPs, returnees, host communities and Palestine refugees are in need of shelter support, representing a 20 per cent increase from 2019. The need for rehabilitation of damaged houses and infrastructure across the country is at a scale that goes beyond the Sector’s humanitarian focus, as well as its capacity. In the belief that shelter projects should be individual-centered, focusing primarily on enabling and assisting household self-recovery. GOPA ensure that the interests and protection of beneﬁciaries are at the local of this project by rehabilitating their house it’s tailored to the different needs of vulnerable IDPs, returnees and affected communities This project basically will target apartment rehabilitation in the following rural areas: 1- 100 Apartments in Palmyra rural Homs. 2- 50 Apartments in Ein Terma (C2315) in rural Damascus. 3- 50 apartments in Nashabiyeh (C2355) in rural Damascus. 4- 50 Apartment in Rabee'a (C3498) in rural Latakia. 5- 25 Apartments in Kafr Zeita (C3463) in rural Hama. 6- 25 apartments in Latmana (C3458) in rural Hama. This project will target 300 HH in rehabilitation of their apartments in all mentioned areas. This project targets rural areas whose families houses have been damaged due to witnessed armed conflicts during Syrian crisis. The economic burden of displaced families will be reduced through the rehabilitation works to their homes, and they will be able to return to their villages and start investing in agricultural and livestock works in their land. - Criteria of selecting beneficiaries in this project will be as following: 1- Poor IDPs returnees are in need of rehabilitation support to make their houses habitable. 2- Families with disabled member, elderly or sick member’s (chronic diseases). 3- The vulnerable families with widows, divorced, orphaned children and extreme poverty. 4- Household without or non-sustainable financial income to cover the life needs such as expenditures for utilities, rent, food and daily expenses. 5- women –headed household families and had no job. 6- families have children specially large number (more 4). - Criteria of selecting apartment in this project will be as following: 1- The apartment should be structurally sound. 2- A title-deed should be a formal confirmation for beneficiary ownership of the apartment. 3- The apartment should be safely accessible in the building to the common works (stairs, roof, entrance and lighting…).
